content: Brian D. Davison, Lehigh University, Computer Science and Engineering Dept. Brian D. Davison, Ph.D. Pronouns: He/him/his Chair, Department of Computer Science and Engineering P.C. Rossin College of Engineering and Applied Science Lehigh University Dr. Brian D. Davison is Professor and Chair of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Professor and Co-founder of the interdisciplinary Master's Program in Data Science, Co-founder of Lehigh's Center for Catastrophe Modeling and Resilience and the Master's Program in Catastrophe Modeling and Resilience, member (former associate director) of the Institute for Data, Intelligent Systems and Computation (I-DISC), and was Founding Director of the undergraduate minor in data science. He regularly teaches data science and previously has taught courses on data mining, web search engines, and more. During his most recent sabbatical, he worked in the Core Data Science group at Facebook (now called Meta). Dr. Davison earned his B.S. in (computer) engineering from Bucknell University and his M.S. and Ph.D. in Computer Science from Rutgers University. His research includes search, mining, recommendation and classification problems in text, on datasets, on the Web and in social networks. He is an NSF Faculty Early Career award winner. Dr. Davison's research has been supported by the National Science Foundation, the National Institutes of Health (NIH), the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency, Microsoft, Amazon, and Sun Microsystems. Dr. Davison's CV is also available. Special opportunity for colleagues in industry, government, etc. Would you be interested in co-advising a doctoral student (who you approve) so that they learn to think in terms of research in your setting, and not just academia? Lehigh has a new program called P3 (Pasteur Partners PhD) that enables such an arrangement with me or my faculty colleagues in any STEM field, focusing on use-inspired research.
